website_summaries.verdict: Grinder that's all about keeping heat generation to a minimum. Runs quieter than some other options.
pros: Grinder wheels each measure 1" width to simplify the work
Slower machine with 1,725 rpm to reduce heat build-up
Uses wheels made from white aluminum oxide to prevent overheating
Well built with a heavy steel base
cons: Some jobs need a faster wheel rotation
Wheels may arrive out of alignment

customer_reviews.title: Grinding out the work.
customer_reviews.text: Great grinder for smaller work! Runs smooth ( only slightly off balance , I am sure it can be adjusted but haven't bothered ) SUPER quiet compared to the ones I am used to. Bought this for my son, and I like it so much I am now going to HIS shop when I need to sharpen my tools! If I keep this up he is going to have a better shop than me shortly :) This is worth every penny. Has enough power and wheel weight to sharpen everything we have thrown at it just as long as you don't bear down on it too hard.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Wheels are not meant for HSS lathe tools
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking to use this to sharpen HSS tools, this grinder is good for the price but..............the wheels are absolutely not meant for that and you will be bashing your head into the wall trying to figure out why you can get anything sharp. They deform immediately after touching the tool and leave a "serrated" edge that will never leave a good cut. I bought this to sharpen lathe tools and as a beginner I just could not figure out why I couldn't get a clean cut off ANY of my tools. I would buy the grinder again if I had to, but would never use these wheels again for anything requiring a fine edge.
customer_reviews.author: Michael F.

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy! Junk Wheels!
customer_reviews.text: The grinding wheels are bad! The 120 wheel is way to soft to sharpen hss lathe tools, even benjamins best! It caused ruts in the wheel immediately. The wheels both are no where near true in a sideways fashion. I have been using a Rikon for a year, which is just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Blix

customer_reviews.title: Lousy product
customer_reviews.text: This grinder came with bent or wobbling grinding wheels. I accept responsibility that I kept it in a box for several months before installing and am unable to return it to Amazon. I contacted Powertec and was informed that it was likely damaged in shipment and there was no fix. Now, I'm stuck with a wobbly grinder. Another problem that buyers should be aware of is that it comes with two wheels that are the same grit. Rikon comes with different grits for a few more bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro J. Ferreyra

customer_reviews.title: The wheel wobble is easily fixed, and inexpensive.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this grinder to sharpen lathe tools. I've been using power tools for just about 45 years, and I feel like this grinder is worth the money. The only issue with it is severe wheel wobble out of the box. I've seen this in other reviews also. I have a remedy for it. Throw the flange washers away, they're the source of the problem. Go to a nut and bolt distributor and get four 9/16 NSS washers for each wheel, problem solved. I spent 25 cents for each. With that being said, you'll have a smooth, quiet machine with ample power.
customer_reviews.author: Fred G

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I needed this slow speed grinder for sharpening my woodturning tools. The speed is 1750 which is needed for this purpose. The only thing negative is that there is no way to hold the shaft when installing the stones. Most grinders have a flat on the shaft that accepts a wrench but this one does not. My suggestion would be to add an inside hex on the end of the shaft for an allen wrench or an outside hex for a wrench or to put the flats on the shaft like other grinders have.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Chester

customer_reviews.title: Love the lower speed and alum ox wheels for low ...
customer_reviews.text: Wheels not true. A lot of vibration. Spent two hours getting to be usable. Once setup the grinder is usable and very smooth for sharpening. Love the lower speed and alum ox wheels for low heat. Worth the money but did not luck out like some others did by being ready to go out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: J Stap

customer_reviews.title: Powertec tools rock
customer_reviews.text: The PowerTec grinder is perfect for sharpening and maintaining my lathe turning tools. It was the second one I received as the first was dropped over the gate by the delivery person and damaged upon opening. I returned it and had a new one in a few days. Not the sellers fault. They were great. Very quite running and steady with no vibration.
customer_reviews.author: Craig L. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: I had bought one for myself and loved it so much that I bought him one to ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son who is a farrier in California. I had bought one for myself and loved it so much that I bought him one to sharpen his shoeing knives. He is in awe of it. Not many farriers in his area have them. Would buy it again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl Van Ness

customer_reviews.title: Headache!
customer_reviews.text: So, it works eventually. First one was broken when it arrived. Got another and it wobbled so bad. I read another review which mentioned replacing the flanges with washers so I did that and it greatly improved the wobble. Then I realized the wheel was misshapen, so I got a new one. Then I bought a diamond wheel dresser and dressed the wheels. Now it works. So yes, it works, but if it's worth it is up to you.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Great for sharpening
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice grinder, once it's working. The first unit I received had a cracked wheel. The replacement was perfect. It runs very smoothly and quietly. I mounted it on a piece of plywood, planning on clamping it to the workbench. However, it was so vibration free that I sharpened my chisels without bothering to clamp. There was no perceptible wobble.
customer_reviews.author: Woodlover

customer_reviews.title: Very smooth
customer_reviews.text: This grinder runs smooth and quiet, used for sharpening wood turning tools, the two different stone grits makes it easy for getting a real good sharp edge.
customer_reviews.author: Timbo

customer_reviews.title: Runs smooth out of box....
customer_reviews.text: Unlike some of the other reviews it runs pretty smooth straight out of the box. Do not have it set up for use yet but quite happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Del

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder for the money
customer_reviews.text: There are not too many slow speed grinders on the market, so I was happy to find this one at a very reasonable price. It worked well right out of the box. The grinding wheels wobbled a little bit, causing some vibration, but that quieted down after using a diamond wheel dresser. Not perfect, but for the money... The tool rest and spark arresters are, um, lightly constructed, but serviceable. Overall, I am very happy with this grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Dick (amateur woodworker and wood turner)

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Very nice quality grinder. Work great for sharpening chisels and turning tools.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Unit was dead out of the box.Wouldn't run just made loud buzzing noise. Returned
customer_reviews.author: Catman

customer_reviews.title: Top notch
customer_reviews.text: this Grinder came well balanced works perfectly for sharpening tools and its fairly quiet
customer_reviews.author: USMC-0317

customer_reviews.title: Wheels are trash.
customer_reviews.text: Mounting holes are broken and crumbing. I expected more for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Been loving it
customer_reviews.text: Been loving it. Great quality for the money and the white wheels do grind cooler. I added the Wolverine jig which really makes it even greater.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Kimball

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and quiet as well. Sharpens my lathe tools easily and without burning.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Hoover

customer_reviews.title: Nice machine
customer_reviews.text: Very nice grinder. The low speed is perfect for my wood turning tools.
customer_reviews.author: Dewayne

customer_reviews.title: Good value, does what I need
customer_reviews.text: The support flats are a little small but this unit does what I need it to. I wanted a lower cost alternative to the Rikon grinder as I am a beginner wood turner.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder for the price didn't have to do anything ...
customer_reviews.text: Great grinder for the price didn't have to do anything but mount it down and put it to work
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder for the money
customer_reviews.text: This isn't a heavy 'hogger'. It is.however a very good grinder for what it's intended. It's for sharpening and light grinding. The price is excellent and quality is good. It's what I expected. I use it with a Wolverine sharpening jig. One wheel wobbled but found a bent support washer and reversed washers on that wheel. Runs great, smooth, and does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Woodbutcher

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: Good price on a good slow speed grinder. I use it almost every day.
customer_reviews.author: Everette B.

customer_reviews.title: great bargain. same machine as the Rikon
customer_reviews.text: great bargain. same machine as the Rikon, but at a discount...and a different color scheme. Left wheel did wobble some when I got it. A little fussing with the flange and its vibration free. Right side worked fine. Overall I'm happy with the results. I have it combined with a Oneway grinding kit. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Severe wobble on left side
customer_reviews.text: Grinder came in today. Plugged it in and had severe wobble on left side. Right side was perfect. Switched the stones to see if it was stones. Nope left side still wobbles. Right side is smooth with which ever stone. Amazon is great. Sending replacement immediately. If the replacement works as expected I will change review and say could be random defect. Will keep you updated.
customer_reviews.author: D. E.

customer_reviews.title: Great product. It requires just a bit of fine ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. It requires just a bit of fine tuning to take the wobble out of it.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Kues

customer_reviews.title: After making adjustments it now runs good enough to sharpen gouges and chisels
customer_reviews.text: The POWERTEC Grinder does not run smoothly, the left wheel has a slight wobble and the right wheel needed to be dressed. After making adjustments it now runs good enough to sharpen gouges and chisels. Don't expect to receive a great grinder for this price. If you purchase this grinder you will have to do some work to get it running correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Chipper

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's an inexpensive grinder and works well. I took the stone wheels off and put CBN wheels on it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Elias

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: Just like everyone else, I had one wobbly wheel. I replaced it with a shop made MDF polishing wheel. Motor does stall if too much pressure is applied but it's fine for my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Lin

customer_reviews.title: Sharpens everything
customer_reviews.text: The wheels on my grinder spin true. Slow speed grinders are the best for sharpening my woodworking tools and this grinder works better than expected for the price. Happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Gwynn

customer_reviews.title: Still out of balance like all the others
customer_reviews.text: It does the job. Still out of balance like all the others.
customer_reviews.author: A. Romano

customer_reviews.title: The grinder runs fine if a bit underpowered
customer_reviews.text: One wheel is out of balance. I can't seem to get it round using my truing tool. I guess I'll replace the offending wheel eventually. The grinder runs fine if a bit underpowered.
customer_reviews.author: BMWRider

customer_reviews.title: Some vibration, but that's to be expected on a ...
customer_reviews.text: Some vibration, but that's to be expected on a low end grinder. I works to sharpen my carbide tipped lathe tools.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford Wenger

customer_reviews.title: A better way to 'sharpen' tools?
customer_reviews.text: This is the way to sharpen tools-----and I love the width and composition of the stones. It's a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Deseret Rider

customer_reviews.title: and I love it.
customer_reviews.text: First grinder I have ever owned, and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Grandmommy

customer_reviews.title: It didn't make it to year 4
customer_reviews.text: Smoke poured out of the motor after running it a bit yesterday. No reason why it should last such a short time in limited hobby use. My 30 year old Craftsman grinder is still running strong. Pretty disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Marc, Cape Cod

customer_reviews.title: Smooth as pie.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice to have wheels one inch wide! Lots of reviewers complain about balance. Not a problem. It is a bench grinder, not a million dollar CNC machine. Works better than I expected under load. I enjoy the white wheels. Nice to flatten the backs of chisels with little worry about explosive heating. At lease now there is early alert to the temperature of the metal. Great buy for a hundred bucks. Be sure to get the 80-ply buffing wheel. The arbor is 5/8 inch.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W.

customer_reviews.title: Good buy, good use, and would purchase again if needed.
customer_reviews.text: As a beginner wood turner, i needed a good quality sharpening system to keep chisels and gouges in good working condition. This fits the bill. Combined with a commercial sharpening jig system, I am able to quickly and accurately get the grind on the tools that I need. Te inch-wide wheels are durable, the lower speed is recommended for the type of work I am doing. Good product, reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Wheels Chipped and Vibrated
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived in new packaging but grinding wheels were chipped on the edges and both wheels wobbled and made the whole machine vibrate. ...I'm not happy!!
customer_reviews.author: Slim Turner

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Grinder itself works well. The hardware, motor and casing seem to be reasonably high quality. The included tool rests are pretty terrible but I immediately replaced them with a Oneway jig anyway. The right wheel was reasonably balanced and true but the left wheel had significant distortion from being flat which causes noticeable vibration at speed. Overall it is about what I expected for the price, with some adjustments and upgrades it should make for a decent grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Haley

product_meta.title: POWERTEC BGSS801 Slow Speed Bench Grinder, 8"
product_meta.description: POWERTEC slow speed grinder is ideal for sharpening tools without generating the edge destroying heat that you get so quickly from 3450 RPM grinders. Wheels are 1" x 8", 60 and 120 grit.
feature_bullets: Cool running 1725 RPM is designed to save tools from overheating
Quiet 1/2HP motor provides long-lasting and smooth performance
White aluminum oxide wheels produce less heat
Heavy gauge steel base reduces vibration and improves stability during operation
